Game Rewind | U of L holds off Marshall

The Cards tip off at 9 p.m. Friday.

Game Rewind | U of L holds off Marshall

Jonathan Lintner, jlintner@courier-journal.com 12:16 a.m. EST November 22, 2014
Buy Photo

U of L's Wayne Blackshear scored a game-high 12 first half points Friday against Marshall.(Photo: By Scott Utterback/The Courier-Journal)Buy Photo

5 CONNECT 10 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

Refresh this page regularly (or click here) for updates before, during and after the University of Louisville's 9 p.m. Friday basketball game against Marshall at the KFC Yum! Center.

Final: U of L 85, Marshall 67.

Montrezl Harrell capped the night with an easy layup on the Cards' final possession, finishing with 12 points and 8 rebounds despite not playing most of the second half.

For a full U of L box score, click here: http://bit.ly/1xY5wnb

Follow this link to watch Rick Pitino live after the game: http://cjky.it/1GC29Hq

Final Cards stats from #UofL's 85-67 win over Marshall: http://t.co/TVeXRDXT68pic.twitter.com/3RQRfZ4fxW

— Jonathan Lintner (@JonathanLintner) November 22, 2014

1:05, 2H: The Cads are cruising now, ahead 81-63, but Rick Pitino hasn't emptied his bench. Chris Jones, Terry Rozier, Wayne Blackshear, Montrezl Harrell and Anton Gill remain on the floor.

2:52, 2H: U of L's out to its largest lead of the game at the under-four timeout. Before the break, Wayne Blackshear capped his big night with a straightaway 3-pointer, giving him 16 points to go with six rebounds.

4:32, 2H: As Marshall hangs around, down 72-59, consider this stat -- the Cards have assisted just 9 of their 25 made baskets. Fouled out for the Thundering Herd is Cheikh Sane, who finished with 10 points.

5:47, 2H: Marshall isn't going away quietly. The Thundering Herd have pulled to within 70-56 of U of L, prompting Montrezl Harrell's re-entry to the game.

7:55, 2H: Walk-on David Levitch caught an outlet pass, went up and was fouled heading into the break. He already has four points tonight as the Cards lead 66-49.

To lead U of L, Terry Rozier has 15 points, Chris Jones 13 and Wayne Blackshear 12.

The Cards have gone 10 deep off the bench, though contributions from Anas Mahmoud and Quentin Snider were brief.

9:00, 2H: Nearing the under-eight timeout, there's no sign of Montrezl Harrell. Not that the Cards, who lead 66-49, need him at this point.

11:59, 2H: With Montrezl Harrell on the bench, still sitting with four fouls, Rick Pitino is giving freshman Anas Mahmoud a shot. It's not going well. He's getting bullied underneath and gave up a basket and foul heading into the under-12 timeout.

U of L's lead, though, remains safe at 59-41. The Cards are just 6 of 15 from the field in the second half, but Marshall is 5 of 15, unable to mount a rally so far.

Important stretch here for Louisville with Montrezl Harrell in foul trouble. Onuaku at the 4 for now.

— Jeff Greer (@jeffgreer_cj) November 22, 2014

12:47, 2H: It's a 13-5 run now for U of L with Chris Jones hitting the Cards' second straight 3-pointer.

14:29, 2H: David Levitch ended U of L's 3-point drought, nailing one from the top of the key to move the Cards ahead 52-31. To that point, U of L was 0 of 13.

15:23, 2H: On a Chinanu Onuaku offensive rebound and putback, U of L has its largest lead at 45-31. The Cards have widened their advantage with Montrezl Harrell on the bench because of foul trouble.

16:29, 2H: The Cards really, really can't get a 3-pointer to drop. On their most recent possession, Wayne Blackshear and Chris Jones both had attempts rim out. U of L is 0 of 13 from long range but leads 43-31.

17:10, 2H: Other than Harrell, U of L isn't in much foul trouble at the under-16 timeout. Chris Jones, Wayne Blackshear and Chinanu Onuake have two apiece; no Cards have three.

Coach Rick PItino on Louisville's win against Marshall.

17:34, 2H: Montrezl Harrell slid under the basket to cover a Marshall post man. The two players bodied up. The whistle went against Harrell, his fourth foul already early in the second half.

U of L leads 43-31.

19:40, 2H: It took Montrezl Harrell 20 seconds to pick up his third foul. Coach Rick Pitino is leaving his star player in the game.

20:00, 2H: U of L's starters are back out to open the second half.

Halftime: Terry Rozier turned it over inside of five seconds left in the half, though Marshall's Aleksa Nikolic missed a layup on the other end to send it to 41-27 at the break.

Wayne Blackshear scored a game-high 12 points, Rozier had 10 and Chris Jones and Montrezl Harrell both chipped in six to lead U of L.

Also, per Garrett Wall of U of L sports information, the Cards failed to hit a 3-pointer for the first time in a half since their victory over Duke in the 2013 NCAA tournament.

Full Cards stats: http://bit.ly/1zL9q30

Louisville stats as the Cards lead Marshall 41-27 at the half: http://t.co/TVeXRDXT68pic.twitter.com/fx4BEVOqGn

— Jonathan Lintner (@JonathanLintner) November 22, 2014

0:59, 1H: Lost in U of L's surge to end the first half? The Cards have done it without Montrezl Harrell, who's on the bench with two fouls. U of L leads 39-27.

1:46, 1H: Marshall's Austin Loop had a wide-open 3-pointer and missed it, but that irked Rick Pitino enough for the coach to call a second timeout this half.

3:04, 1H: U of L's pulling away now, out to a 37-23 advantage on a Wayne Blackshear alley-oop and Chinanu Onuaku layup out of the timeout. It's the Cards' largest lead thanks to a 19-5 run.

3:58, 1H: Wayne Blackshear has been hot and cold tonight, the story of U of L's game so far. He opened the game with a layup and has had two monstrous dunks. He's also drawn two charges, including one that sent this to the under-four timeout with the Cards ahead 31-23. But Blackshear also gave up a basket and foul, and he's 3 of 10 from the field (0 for 4 from 3-point range).

U of L has its lead thanks to a dominating paint presence, out-scoring Marshall there 22-12.

Wayne Blackshear is as pumped up as I've ever seen him. Has eight points, four rebounds and three steals. Couple of dunk-and-screams.

— Jeff Greer (@jeffgreer_cj) November 22, 2014

5:57, 1H: In a frenetically-paced game, Wayne Blackshear came up with another steal and dunk, then on the other end of the court drew a charge. U of L's lead is 27-20 -- it's largest of the night -- and the Thundering Herd's Tamron Manning picked up his third foul on the last whistle.

7:35, 1H: Wayne Blackshear's aggressive play has U of L back in the lead against Marshall. His steal and two-handed dunk broke a 20-20 tie into the under-eight timeout. The Cards are off to a cold start shooting, just 8 of 24 on all field goals and 0 for 10 on 3-pointers. Marshall is, meanwhile, 8 of 11.

9:19, 1H: Sophomore Anton Gill, recently checked in, drove hard to the basket and drew a quick foul. He missed both free throws, moving to 1 of 7 on the season, but made up for it with a steal and dunk on the next possession to tie the score at 18-18.

11:35, 1H: Wayne Blackshear rimmed out a 3-pointer, and Marshall's Justin Edmonds was quick to turn and throw it nearly the length of the court. Devince Boykins out-ran U of L's guards and slammed a dunk that has the Thundering Herd ahead 18-15 at the under-12 timeout.

U of L has opened 6 of 18 from the field but has an 8-7 rebounding edge.

12:40, 1H: Marshall leads 16-15 behind 7 points from Ryan Taylor, who's also assisted two Thundering Herd baskets.

14:01, 1H: Marshall starter Shawn Smith has already picked up his second foul with the score knotted 12-12. U of L had a lead, temporarily, on a Terry Rozier up-and-under layup -- play of the game so far.

15:48, 1H: The Cards' response to Marshall's hot start was a run back to a 10-10 tie at the first media timeout. Four U of L players have already scored -- every starter except Chinanu Onuaku -- with four points coming on second chances and six in the paint.

17:57, 1H: Wayne Blackshear opened with a layup to move U of L ahead 2-0, but it's been all Marshall since then, as the Thundering Herd responded with a 7-0 run to prompt an early Rick Pitino timeout.

20:00, 1H: Starters confirmed -- it's Chris Jones, Terry Rozier, Wayne Blackshear, Montrezl Harrell and Chinanu Onuaku out to open this one for U of L.

PREGAME: Thanks to early common opponent Jacksonville State, there's already an idea of how this U of L-Marshall matchup may go.

The Thundering Herd beat Jacksonville 74-55 last Friday in its season opener. Three days later, the Cardinals ran away from that same team to an 88-39 victory.

And that results in a 30-point spread for Friday's game.

--Marshall is coached by Dan D'Antoni, a former star Thundering Herd guard. With D'Antoni hired last April, a different staff will be on the sidelines from the one that pushed U of L in a November 2010 matchup.

--And some stats: U of L coach Rick Piitno is three wins from 700, and on an unrelated note, the Cards' 60-26 rebounding edge posted in the Jacksonville State game was their widest since a 2005 game against East Carolina.

--For more before a late tipoff, check out a game preview (http://cjky.it/1qCv0H4) and story lines (http://cjky.it/1BQFur8).

Probable U of L Starters

G Chris Jones

G Terry Rozier

F Wayne Blackshear

F Montrezl Harrell

C Chinanu Onuaku

Probable Marshall Starters

G Austin Loop

F DeVince Boykins

F Ryan Taylor

F Shawn Smith

F Cheikh Sane
